item.title: Devon Walker Departs ‘Saturday Night Live’ After Three Seasons
item.description: He joined the show in 2022 and was made a repertory player last season.

item.title: Why Do Sketch Comedians Keep Getting Snubbed by the Emmys?
item.description: They’re some of our most talented performers. Yet TV Academy voters constantly overlook them.

item.title: Pete Davidson Thinks He Might Have Been “Annoying” to ‘SNL’ Cast: “I Did Rub People the Wrong Way”
item.description: The comedian insisted no one was mean to him on the NBC show though he feared his co-stars weren’t fans of his sudden rise to fame.

item.title: Pete Davidson Reveals Origins of ‘SNL’ Character Chad
item.description: “In eight years of ‘SNL,’ I had one character,” the actor said of the recurring role known for his “OK” catchphrase.

item.title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ Visual Effects Workers Ratify First Union Contract
item.description: IATSE members unanimously voted to greenlight the deal, which includes AI language and “kill fees” for workers whose projects are canceled.
